name: Regensburg
fun_fact: Fun fact: The Historische Wurstkuchl (Historic Sausage Kitchen) has been continuously open for over 500 years, making it one of the oldest restaurants in the world - and they've been serving the exact same charcoal-grilled sausages using medieval recipes the entire time, only accepting cash payments.

hero_dishes.name: Regensburger Wurst at Historische Wurstkuchl
hero_dishes.description: Charcoal-grilled pork sausages made with a secret blend of herbs and spices, served with homemade sauerkraut or fresh rolls
hero_dishes.origin_story: The recipe has been handed down through generations since the Middle Ages when this tiny restaurant fed workers building the Stone Bridge. Over 500 years later, locals still line up for the same sausages
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Historische Wurstkuchl (over 500 years old - cash only, gets crowded at lunch)
